definitions: exclamation used to express joy, triumph, or enthusiastic approval
organized cheer or shout of approval, especially in a group setting
examples: The crowd gave a loud hurrah when the home team scored
Hurrah filled the stadium as victory was announced
Three hurrahs for the graduating class echoed through the auditorium
The soldiers ended their ceremony with a traditional hurrah

definitions: powerful tropical cyclone with winds exceeding seventy-four miles per hour
examples: The hurricane devastated coastal communities with its 150-mph winds
Weather forecasters tracked the hurricane across the Atlantic Ocean
Emergency services prepared extensively before the hurricane made landfall
Hurricane season runs from June through November each year

definitions: state of moving or acting quickly with urgency
pressing need to accomplish something quickly
examples: There's no hurry to finish the project this week
She left the house in a terrible hurry
What's the hurry with getting these documents signed today
The hurry to meet deadlines caused several mistakes

definitions: physical pain or injury experienced by a person or animal
emotional distress, suffering, or psychological pain
damage or negative impact inflicted on something
examples: The hurt from her broken ankle lasted several weeks
Athletes often play through minor hurts and pains
The hurt in his eyes was evident after the betrayal
Years of therapy helped her process childhood hurts
The scandal caused significant hurt to the company's reputation
Economic downturns inflict hurt on vulnerable communities

definitions: continuous experience of physical or emotional pain or distress
examples: The hurting in her joints worsened during cold weather
Months of hurting finally led him to seek medical help
The community's hurting after the tragedy brought everyone together
Economic hurting affects families across the entire region

definitions: man joined to another person in marriage or similar partnership
examples: Her husband surprised her with anniversary flowers every year
The husband and wife celebrated their golden wedding anniversary
My husband handles most of the household financial planning
She introduced her husband to her new colleagues

definitions: practice of breeding and caring for farm animals
careful management and conservation of resources or provisions
examples: Modern animal husbandry focuses on both productivity and welfare
His expertise in poultry husbandry improved egg production significantly
Through careful husbandry of resources, the project stayed under budget
Good husbandry of the land ensures sustainable farming practices

definitions: state of silence, quietness, or absence of noise
examples: A sudden hush fell over the crowded auditorium
The hush of early morning filled the empty streets
She spoke in a hush to avoid waking the baby
The library maintained its traditional hush throughout the day

definitions: dry outer covering of certain seeds or fruits
empty shell or outer layer that remains after contents are removed
examples: Corn husks are often used for wrapping tamales
The machine efficiently removes husks from the harvested grain
After the fire, only the husk of the building remained
He felt like a husk after years of emotional exhaustion

definitions: Arctic dog breed with thick fur coat used for pulling sleds
examples: The Siberian husky pulled the sled through deep snow
Her husky has distinctive blue eyes and thick fur
Training a husky requires patience and consistent exercise routines
The rescue husky adapted well to its new family

definitions: energetic movement or activity, especially in pursuit of success
fraudulent or deceptive scheme to obtain money
examples: The hustle of downtown streets energized her creative work
His entrepreneurial hustle led to three successful businesses
The street hustle involved selling fake designer watches
Police warned tourists about common hustles targeting visitors

definitions: person who works energetically to achieve success or make money
person who uses deceptive methods to obtain money from others
examples: The young hustler built her business from nothing
Successful hustlers in Silicon Valley often work eighteen-hour days
The hustler convinced tourists to buy worthless souvenirs
Card hustlers frequented the casino looking for easy marks

definitions: small, simple dwelling typically made of natural materials
examples: The beach hut provided shelter from the afternoon sun
Mountain climbers rested in the wooden hut overnight
Traditional huts in the village were made from mud and thatch
The guard hut stood at the entrance gate

definitions: cage or pen for keeping rabbits or other small animals
cupboard or cabinet with shelves for displaying china or dishes
examples: The rabbit hutch needs cleaning twice a week
She built a spacious hutch for her pet guinea pigs
The antique hutch displayed three generations of family china
They bought a pine hutch for their dining room

definitions: bulbous plant with fragrant bell-shaped flowers in dense spikes
examples: Purple hyacinths bloomed in the spring garden beds
The sweet scent of hyacinths filled the greenhouse
She planted hyacinth bulbs in decorative indoor pots
Water hyacinths can quickly cover pond surfaces

definitions: organism produced by crossing two different species or varieties
product combining elements from different sources or technologies
examples: The hybrid corn variety showed improved drought resistance
Garden centers sell many hybrid rose varieties
Her hybrid car switches between electric and gasoline power
The course uses a hybrid model of online and classroom learning

definitions: process of combining different varieties or species to produce hybrids
examples: Hybridisation between wild and domestic species creates new varieties
The hybridisation programme improved crop yields significantly
Natural hybridisation occurs when related species share habitats
Scientists studied hybridisation patterns in butterfly populations

definitions: process of combining different varieties or species to produce hybrids
examples: Hybridization techniques revolutionized agricultural crop production
The hybridization of wolves and dogs occurred thousands of years ago
Molecular hybridization helps identify specific DNA sequences
Cultural hybridization creates new forms of artistic expression

definitions: small freshwater polyp with tentacles that regenerates when cut
persistent problem that multiplies when confronted
examples: The biology students observed hydra specimens under microscopes
Hydra reproduce both sexually and through budding
Corruption proved to be a hydra that resisted all reforms
The criminal organization was a hydra with multiple heads

definitions: shrub with large clusters of white, pink, or blue flowers
examples: The hydrangea bushes produced enormous blue flower heads
She dried hydrangea blooms for winter arrangements
Soil acidity determines whether hydrangeas bloom pink or blue
The garden featured a stunning hydrangea border

definitions: upright pipe with valve for drawing water from mains
examples: Firefighters connected their hoses to the nearest hydrant
The red fire hydrant stood on every street corner
City workers tested hydrants throughout the neighborhood annually
Parking near a hydrant results in hefty fines

definitions: chemical compound containing water molecules within its crystal structure
examples: Copper sulfate hydrate contains five water molecules per formula
The hydrate lost water when heated above 100 degrees
Salt hydrates are used for thermal energy storage
The mineral forms a stable hydrate under normal conditions

definitions: chemical process of combining with water molecules
maintenance of adequate water levels in the body
examples: Cement hydration generates heat during the curing process
The hydration reaction converts anhydrous salts to hydrates
Proper hydration is essential for athletic performance
Doctors monitored the patient's hydration levels carefully

definitions: organic compound consisting entirely of hydrogen and carbon atoms
examples: Natural gas consists primarily of methane and other hydrocarbons
Petroleum refineries separate crude oil into various hydrocarbons
Aromatic hydrocarbons like benzene have distinctive ring structures
The combustion of hydrocarbons produces carbon dioxide and water

definitions: electricity generated by water flow through turbines at dams
examples: Hydroelectricity provides clean renewable energy to millions of homes
The dam generates enough hydroelectricity for the entire region
Norway produces most of its electricity from hydroelectricity
Investment in hydroelectricity infrastructure continues to grow

definitions: wing-like structure that lifts boats above water at speed
boat equipped with hydrofoils for high-speed travel
examples: The hydrofoil design reduces drag by lifting the hull
Engineers tested new hydrofoil configurations in the tank
The passenger hydrofoil crossed the strait in half the usual time
Military hydrofoils can reach speeds over sixty knots

definitions: lightest chemical element with atomic number one, existing as colorless gas
examples: Hydrogen fuel cells power some electric vehicles
Stars convert hydrogen into helium through nuclear fusion
The hydrogen atom consists of one proton and one electron
Green hydrogen production uses renewable electricity

definitions: scientific study of water movement, distribution, and quality on Earth
examples: Hydrology experts assessed the watershed's flood risk
The university offers advanced degrees in hydrology
Climate change significantly impacts regional hydrology patterns
Hydrology models predict future water availability

definitions: high-speed racing boat designed to skim water surface
dangerous skidding of vehicle tires on wet road surface
examples: The hydroplane reached speeds exceeding 200 miles per hour
Vintage hydroplanes competed in the annual regatta
The car began to hydroplane on the rain-slicked highway
Drivers should reduce speed to prevent hydroplane incidents

definitions: therapeutic use of water for pain relief and treating illness
examples: The physiotherapist recommended hydrotherapy for her arthritis
Hydrotherapy pools maintain warmer temperatures than regular pools
Athletes use hydrotherapy to accelerate injury recovery
The spa offers various hydrotherapy treatments

definitions: dog-like carnivorous mammal native to Africa and Asia with powerful jaws
examples: The spotted hyena has one of the strongest bites among mammals
Hyenas hunt in packs and scavenge from other predators
The laughing sound of hyenas echoed across the savanna
Contrary to popular belief, hyenas are skilled hunters

definitions: conditions or practices that maintain health through cleanliness
examples: Good dental hygiene prevents cavities and gum disease
The restaurant maintained excellent kitchen hygiene standards
Personal hygiene habits vary significantly across cultures
Hand hygiene became crucial during the pandemic

definitions: religious song of praise typically sung in worship services
examples: The congregation sang traditional hymns during Sunday service
She composed a new hymn for the church anniversary
The hymn book contained hundreds of beloved songs
National hymns often express patriotic sentiments

definitions: book containing collection of hymns for worship services
examples: The church purchased new hymnals for the congregation
She found her grandmother's old hymnal in the attic
The hymnal included both traditional and contemporary songs
Digital hymnals are replacing printed books in some churches

definitions: extravagant or intensive publicity or promotion creating inflated expectations
examples: The movie failed to live up to its pre-release hype
Marketing hype surrounded the new product launch
Media hype often distorts public perception of events
Despite the hype, the technology proved disappointing

definitions: abnormally or extremely active behavior, especially in children
examples: The doctor evaluated the child for signs of hyperactivity
Sugar consumption doesn't actually cause hyperactivity in children
Hyperactivity often accompanies attention deficit disorder
Teachers developed strategies to manage student hyperactivity

definitions: symmetrical open curve formed by intersection of cone with plane
examples: Students graphed the hyperbola using its standard equation
The hyperbola has two separate branches
Planetary orbits sometimes follow hyperbola paths
The mathematician explained hyperbola properties

definitions: deliberate exaggeration used for emphasis or dramatic effect, not meant literally
examples: Saying 'I've told you a million times' is obvious hyperbole
The poet used hyperbole to convey intense emotion
Political speeches often contain hyperbole to sway voters
Her hyperbole made the story more entertaining

definitions: very large self-service store combining supermarket and department store
examples: The hypermarket sells everything from groceries to electronics
European hypermarkets pioneered the one-stop shopping concept
The new hypermarket covers over 200,000 square feet
Hypermarkets offer lower prices through bulk purchasing

definitions: abnormally acute physical or emotional sensitivity to stimuli
examples: The allergy test revealed hypersensitivity to several foods
Hypersensitivity reactions require immediate medical attention
Emotional hypersensitivity can indicate underlying psychological conditions
Drug hypersensitivity affects many patients

definitions: persistently elevated blood pressure in arteries requiring medical management
examples: Untreated hypertension increases risk of heart disease
The doctor prescribed medication to control her hypertension
Lifestyle changes can help manage mild hypertension
Regular monitoring detected his developing hypertension early

definitions: text displayed on computer with references to other text accessible immediately
examples: Web pages use hypertext links to connect related information
The hypertext markup language revolutionized internet communication
Students navigated through hypertext documents for research
Hypertext allows non-linear reading experiences

definitions: punctuation mark (-) used to join words or separate syllables
examples: The hyphen in 'mother-in-law' connects the compound word
Use a hyphen when splitting words at line breaks
Twenty-one requires a hyphen between the words
The editor added hyphens to clarify the meaning

definitions: medication that induces sleep or produces hypnosis-like state
examples: The doctor prescribed a mild hypnotic for her insomnia
Some hypnotics can cause dependency with prolonged use
The new hypnotic showed fewer side effects than older drugs
Emergency rooms stock various hypnotics for procedures

definitions: practice of inducing hypnotic state for therapeutic or entertainment purposes
examples: Stage hypnotism entertains audiences with volunteer participants
Clinical hypnotism helps some patients manage chronic pain
She studied hypnotism to enhance her therapy practice
Hypnotism remains controversial despite documented benefits

definitions: person who practices hypnotism professionally or as entertainment
examples: The stage hypnotist made volunteers perform silly acts
A certified hypnotist helped her overcome her phobia
The hypnotist used a pendulum to induce trance
Police sometimes consult hypnotists for witness recall

definitions: practice of claiming moral standards while behaving contrary to them
examples: Political hypocrisy undermines public trust in government
The preacher's hypocrisy shocked his congregation
She couldn't tolerate the hypocrisy of environmental polluters
Corporate hypocrisy regarding worker rights sparked protests

definitions: person who pretends to have virtues or beliefs they don't practice
examples: The environmental hypocrite drove a gas-guzzling vehicle
Don't be a hypocrite by criticizing others' mistakes
History exposed many reformers as hypocrites
The hypocrite preached charity while hoarding wealth

definitions: hollow needle for injection beneath the skin
examples: The nurse prepared a hypodermic for the vaccination
Diabetics use hypodermic needles for insulin injections
The hypodermic delivery ensured rapid medication absorption
Disposal of used hypodermics requires special containers

definitions: abnormally low blood glucose level requiring immediate treatment
examples: Severe hypoglycemia can cause confusion and fainting
Diabetics monitor carefully to prevent hypoglycemia episodes
The athlete experienced hypoglycemia during the marathon
Symptoms of hypoglycemia include shakiness and sweating
